title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20 §§ 8186-3.1 - Deadline for establishment
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20 §§ 8186-3.1 - Deadline for establishment

State Regulations
(a) The approval deadline is the last day for the approval, certification or
establishment of a special equalization rate or a change in level of assessment
factor. (1)

In the case of a material change
in level of assessment, the approval deadline may not be later than the last
date provided by law for the levy of a tax upon such roll. (2)

In the case of any other change in level
of assessment, the approval deadline shall be no later than the earlier of 10
days prior to first levy date or the 45th day, including Saturdays, Sundays and
holidays, after the last statutory date for the filing of the final assessment
roll. (3)

For the purpose of
certification of a change in level of assessment factor for residential
assessment ratios the approval deadline is the date specified in section
738
of the Real Property Tax Law. (b) First levy date is the last
statutory day for the levy of any tax for any purpose upon the final assessment
roll or a portion thereof. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20
§§
8186-3.1

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
